meanings.definition: Prepare (written material) for publication by correcting, condensing, or otherwise modifying it.
meanings.sent1: She is editing her essay to fix any mistakes before submitting it.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy editing my photos to make them look better.
meanings.sent3: The teacher was editing the student's story and accidentally turned it into a comedy.
meanings.sent4: Her editing skills are like a magic wand, transforming rough drafts into polished works.
meanings.sent5: The process of editing can turn a jumbled mess into a clear and organized piece.

meanings.definition: Make changes to (data) in order to prepare it for viewing or printing.
meanings.sent1: He is editing the spreadsheet to include the latest sales figures.
meanings.sent2: Editing the document before sharing it ensures accuracy.
meanings.sent3: The computer was editing the file so fast, it seemed like it had a mind of its own.
meanings.sent4: The editor's job is like editing a puzzle, fitting all the pieces together perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The process of editing data requires attention to detail and precision.
